alert.note: Alert for Garfield; Petroleum (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 02 at 2:27PM MDT until June 03 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Glasgow MT has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Montana... Musselshell River at Mosby affecting Garfield and Petroleum Counties. For the Musselshell River...including Mosby...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Musselshell River at Mosby. * WHEN...Until tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.5 feet, Low land flooding begins. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM MDT Friday the stage was 9.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage with a maximum value of 11.0 feet this evening. It will fall below flood stage by Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.0 feet on 06/18/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Musselshell River Mosby 10.0 9.4 Fri 1 pm MDT 6.7 6.4 6.5 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Saturday morning at 1100 AM MDT.
